name: Provision of first and last name
Account holder confirmation
description: Technical Data / Supply
examples: Yes, the contract is in my name.

name: Number of household members
description: Consumption / Habits
examples: There are four of us at home.

name: Description of estimated annual consumption
examples: I use about 2700 kWh per year.

name: Consumption time slots
examples: I use more electricity in the evening.

name: Use of electricity for heating
description: Decision / Offer Acceptance
examples: I use electric heaters in winter.

name: Request for time to decide
examples: I need to think about it.

name: Request for alternative proposal
description: Consent / Compliance

name: Privacy consent
examples: Yes, I accept the data processing.

name: Voice recording consent
description: Requests / Information

name: Question about contract duration
examples: How long does the offer last?

name: Request to send documentation
description: Objections / Issues
examples: Can you send me the contract by email?

name: Price objection
examples: It seems too expensive to me.

name: Report of arrears or previous issues
description: Closing / Follow-Up
examples: I've had problems with the bill.

name: Request for recontact
examples: Can you call me back tomorrow?

name: Refusal of callback
examples: I'd rather not be contacted again.

name: Final greeting
description: Emotional / Attitudinal Reactions

name: Expression of dissatisfaction
description: "I'm already tired of these calls."

name: Expression of surprise or uncertainty
description: "Really? I didn't think it was so easy to change supplier."
discursive: "Really? I didn't think it was so easy to change supplier."

name: Expression of enthusiasm
description: "Great, it really seems interesting!"

name: Ironic / provocative tone
description: "So you're giving me electricity for free, right?"
discursive: "So you're giving me electricity for free, right?"

name: Request for self-activation link
description: "Can you send me a link and I'll do it myself?"
discursive: "Can you send me a link and I'll do it myself?"

name: Preference for self-service / app
description: "If I can do everything from the app, that's better."
discursive: "If I can do everything from the app, that's better."

name: Check on offer validity
description: "Is it also written on the website, this offer?"
discursive: "Is it also written on the website, this offer?"

name: Check operator reliability
description: "Can you tell me your code and where you work?"
category: ðŸ“‚ Expression of latent or implicit needs
discursive: "Can you tell me your code and where you work?"

name: Indirect question about savings
description: "But in the end, do I really save something or not?"
category: ðŸ“‚ Expression of latent or implicit needs
discursive: "But in the end, do I really save something or not?"

name: Question about real duration of the procedure
description: "How long does it take to change supplier?"
discursive: "How long does it take to change supplier?"

name: Reporting inconvenient moment
description: "I can't talk right now, call me back."
discursive: "I can't talk right now, call me back."

name: Declaration of not being the account holder
description: "I'm not the account holder, it's my husband."
discursive: "I'm not the account holder, it's my husband."

name: Communication of imminent house move
description: "I'm about to move, does it make sense to activate now?"
discursive: "I'm about to move, does it make sense to activate now?"

name: Question about first bill
description: "When will I receive the first invoice?"
discursive: "When will I receive the first invoice?"

name: Request for access to customer area
description: Defensive / disengaged behaviors

name: Refusal to provide data
description: "I don't want to give my tax code."
discursive: "I don't want to give my tax code."

name: Refusal to listen to the offer
description: "I'm not interested, I'm in a hurry."
discursive: "I'm not interested, I'm in a hurry."

name: Immediate closing
description: "No thanks, goodbye."

name: Vague / evasive answer
description: "Yes... well... I don't know..."

name: Request for repetition
description: "Can you repeat the amount?"

name: Expression of doubt / suspicion
description: "Are you sure this is a real company?"
discursive: "Are you sure this is a real company?"

name: Comparison with competitor offers
description: "Enel charges me less per kWh."

name: Quoting regulations / conditions
description: "I have the right to withdraw within 14 days, right?"
discursive: "I have the right to withdraw within 14 days, right?"

name: Question about specific contract clauses
description: "Is there a penalty if I close before 12 months?"
discursive: "Is there a penalty if I close before 12 months?"

name: Request to speak in another language
description: "Do you speak English?"

name: Expression of difficulty understanding
description: "You speak too fast, I don't understand."
category: ðŸ“‚ Historical data or past relationship
discursive: "You speak too fast, I don't understand."

name: Reference to previous contact
description: "You already called me last week."
category: ðŸ“‚ Historical data or past relationship

name: Reporting recent supplier change
description: "I've already changed supplier recently."

name: Request for paper / electronic invoice
description: "Can I receive the bill only in paper form?"
discursive: "Can I receive the bill only in paper form?"

name: Communication of IBAN / account change
description: Associate modifiers or secondary signals (e.g. hesitation, sarcasm, urgency).
discursive: Associate modifiers or secondary signals (e.g. hesitation, sarcasm, urgency).
